conclusion: The p-V diagram shows an ideal gas undergoing two adiabatic and two isochoric processes.
From state a to state b, the process is isochoric (constant volume).
From state b to state c, the process is adiabatic (no heat exchange).
In an isochoric process, the work done by the gas is zero (W = 0).
The change in internal energy (ΔU) is equal to the heat added (Q) because no work is done (ΔU = Q).
In an adiabatic process, there is no heat exchange (Q = 0).
The change in internal energy (ΔU) is equal to the work done by the gas (ΔU = -W).

premise: The internal energy at state a is Ua. The internal energy at state b is Ub, which is higher than Ua due to the heat added during the isochoric process.
The internal energy at state c is Uc, which is lower than Ub due to the work done by the gas during the adiabatic process.
